thread.title: Carnival Corp. gets approval to ship cruisers to Cuba
thread.title_full: Carnival Corp. gets approval to ship cruisers to Cuba

author: Emon Reiser
title: Carnival Corp. gets approval to ship cruisers to Cuba
text: Carnival Corp. gets approval to ship cruisers to Cuba Jul 7, 2015, 12:32pm EDT Jock Fistick Doral-based Carnival Cruise Line employs more than 40,000 people worldwide. Carnival Corp. announced that the U.S. Department of Commerce has been granted approval for the company to begin travel to Cuba. The Miami-based cruise company plans to add a Cuba itinerary to its newly rolled out cruise line, Fathom, which will launch its maiden voyage in April 2016 to the Dominican Republic from PortMiami. Travel to Cuba on Fathom's ship is expected by May 2016. It is authorized under current U.S.-to-Cuba travel guidelines that allow licensed travel companies to transport approved travelers to Cuba to engage in activities that support the island's residents, the company said. Bizspace Spotlight
